input:

input:

(A)The forward static friction force of the ground on the horse is greater than any friction forces acting backward on the cart, providing a forward acceleration. (B)The forward force of the horse on the cart is greater than the backward force of the cart on the horse, providing a forward acceleration. (C)The force of the horse’s muscles on the rest of the horse-cart system provides the necessary acceleration. (D)The upward normal force of the ground on the horse is greater than the horse’s weight, providing an upward acceleration.
